intro: Lysimachia lanceolata subsp. hybrida, commonly known as the hybrid yellow loosestrife, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm, with slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellow, five-petaled flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped, with a smooth or slightly serrated edge, and are arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks.
